newsitem.title: UK: Chelsea plans unaffected by Harding death.
newsitem.headline: Chelsea plans unaffected by Harding death.

text.p: Chelsea Village Plc, owner of Chelsea Football Club, said the death of its vice-chairman Matthew Harding in a helicopter crash on Tuesday night would not affect its future plans.
In a statement, the company said that Harding's promised financial commitment "was totally in place."
The club said "the next phase is achieving his, and indeed all Chelsea fans' dream, of having a world class team in a world class stadium."

Harding, 42, was one of five people who died when the helicopter they were travelling in crashed into a field on the way back to London after a match between Chelsea and Bolton Wanderers in north west England.
The multi-millionaire bought the club's Stamford Bridge ground in London's Fulham Road for 16.5 million stg in 1995 and provided more cash for stadium improvements and to buy top overseas players.
